attributes.action: Sex offenders to be subject to approval by communities before being housed
attributes.additional_details: Child sex abuse and grooming won't be tolerated in N.Ireland. The laws must change to allow parents/guardians to be aware that a sex offender is applying to move into their communities, allowing them the options to accept or decline sex offender/s to be housed there. This is to further safe guard children.
attributes.background: Government must put in place community awareness and approval BEFORE a registered sex offender is housed within the area.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about housing for offenders in Northern Ireland are a matter for the Northern Ireland institutions and relevant local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you want to raise this issue you could contact your MLA. You can find contact details for your MLAs here: http://www.niassembly.gov.uk/your-mlas/
